alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 3:29PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central San Diego County through 415 PM PDT... At 329 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78 and Shelter Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Mountains
